title: Rams' Clay Matthews out at least a month with broken jaw
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Chances are if you've been paying attention to Lorenzo's Locks you've been making money. Listen to what he has to say about betting on Week 5. USA TODAY

The Los Angeles Rams will be without their leading sack artist for at least a month. Clay Matthews suffered a broken jaw on Thursday night against the Seattle Seahawks and will be out for an extended period of time.

Sean McVay said Friday it'll sideline Matthews for at least a month. It's a significant blow for the Rams, who aren't exactly deep at outside linebacker.

The Rams think Matthews was hurt when Seahawks running back Chris Carson inadvertently kicked the linebacker in the face. Matthews was also hit with another crucial and controversial "roughing the passer" penalty on Russell Wilson in Thursday night's loss.

“He’s a tough guy, but it was a physical game,” McVay said. “It was something that you just hate for him because of how productive he’s been for us and what he’s meant to our team and all the things that he’s done. It’s going to be a big loss. Guys are going to be asked to step up in his absence.”

Matthews leads the team in sacks with six, which is 2.5 more than he had all of last season.

Sean McVay on Clay Matthews' injury: "That’s not good for us. That’s a big injury." Matthews got kicked in the jaw as he tried to tackle Seahawks' Chris Carson near the end of the game. — Kevin Modesti (@KevinModesti) October 4, 2019

Matthews wasn’t playing every snap, but he was a key contributor when called upon. He was sharing time with Samson Ebukam outside.

The Rams signed Matthews to a two-year deal this offseason.

Contributing: Associated Press
description: Clay Matthews suffered a broken jaw in the Rams' Thursday night loss to the Seahawks and will be out at least a month.
